page.title: 10Farming Around Kirtlington
page.content: Mr. Hunter told us about Vicarage Farm which he owns. It has 220 acres valued at 1700 - 2000 pounds per acre. This acreage is divided into 140 acres of cereals and 80 acres of grass. The 140 acres of cereal comprise 60 acres barley, 60 acres wheat and 20 acres oats. If these crops produce a good quality yield they will be used for human consumption but if they do not reach the required standard they will be used for animal feed. The grassland is used for cattle and is made up of permanent pasture and grass leys. The 160 head of cattle are bought in at 2 weeks old from dairy farms and sold at 18 months to be fattened for beef. Mr. Hunter's farming is traditional with English cattle and standard crops. He employs one workman and relies heavily on powerful machinery.
